page.title: 17WARSOP-STEBBING
page.content: On Friday 12th July Shaun,Andrew and I went to visit Warsop-Stebbing cricket bat makers. The company was started in 1870 by Ben Warsop.They have a big range of cricket bats.They also make rounders bats,hockey sticks and padder tennis bats.The man that works there has been working there for 38 years.The cricket bats are made of willow.They get the willow from farmers in Essex,Suffolk and Surrey.The building they work in was established in 1960.They work 9 hours a day.The man said that it takes about 45 minutes to make a size 6 cricket bat.It costs about Â£14 to produce a size 6 cricket bat.The man makes about 30 cricket bats a day.There are 3 workers in the workshop.They sell there cricket bats to Australia,The West Indies,Canada,Holland and South Africa.
